intro: Minuartia asiyeae, commonly known as the Asiatic rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is native to regions of Central Asia and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
